citation.article-title: Polaromonas vacuolata gen. nov., sp. nov., a psychrophilic, marine, gas vacuolate bacterium from Antarctica.

p.s: Polaromonas (Po.lar.o.mo'nas. M. L. adj. Polaris, pertaining to the geographic poles; Gr. fem. n. monas, unit; M. L. fem. n. Polaromonas, polar bacterium)
Cigar-shaped, gram negative rods that are 0.8 by 2.0 to 3.0 μm, Encapsulated.
Chemoorganotrophic and catalase and oxidase positive.
Requires amino acids, but not vitamins, for growth.
Motile by means of a polar flagellum.
The maximum growth temperature of known strains is 15°C.
The G+C contents are 52 to 57 mol% (as determined by the thermal denaturation method) (9).
The only species is the type species, Polaromonas vacuolata.
